holidays.title: New Year
holidays.description: A bright and cheerful holiday - New Year's - is celebrated in most countries according to the Gregorian calendar, on the night from December 31 to January 1. Find out where and how it's celebrated, what traditions and features exist, how to congratulate and how to please loved ones on New Year's.

holidays.title: Science Fiction Day
holidays.description: January 2 is celebrated as Science Fiction Day. Among fans of various literary genres, there are many admirers of science fiction, united by their love for this direction in literature, cinema, and other forms of art.

holidays.title: World Introvert Day
holidays.description: On January 2, 2011, the unofficial but instantly global World Introvert Day was celebrated for the first time. For many people, the concepts of "introvert" and "extrovert" are known from the basics of psychology, studied in school or at university.

holidays.title: Birthday of the cocktail straw
holidays.description: January 3 is celebrated around the world as an unusual holiday - this date is considered the Birthday of the Drinking Straw (Drinking Straw Day). A straw is a device in the form of a tube, designed for sucking any drinks into the mouth, with the aim of subsequent

holidays.title: Newton's Day
holidays.description:
Oh, how many wonderful discoveries
The spirit of enlightenment prepares for us,
And experience, the son of difficult mistakes,
And genius, the friend of paradoxes,
And chance, the god of invention...
A.S. Pushkin
It's not a coincidence that it is appropriate to remember in the first days of the new year.

holidays.title: International Unloading Day
holidays.description: Every year on December 31st, people start behaving strangely. From morning until almost evening, they cook, eating almost nothing, and closer to midnight, they sit at the table and start eating. A lot. Bowls of salads are eaten, as well as several variations of hot dishes.

holidays.title: International Scout Day
holidays.description: January 5 is celebrated as International Scouts Day. For many representatives of the older and middle generations of Russians, the word "scout" (Eng. scout) has long been associated with a youth movement that was part of Western culture, and

holidays.title: International Choreographer's Day
holidays.description: January 9 is celebrated as International Choreographer's Day. This holiday is dedicated to those people who carefully preserve and increase the technique and plasticity of dance art, teaching future performers. The love of humanity for the art of dance, the hall

holidays.title: International "Thank You" Day
holidays.description: January 11 can be called one of the most "polite" dates of the year without exaggeration - today International Thank You Day is celebrated. Every year more and more countries and people join in the celebration of this day.

holidays.title: Old New Year
holidays.description: The tradition of celebrating the Old New Year comes from the discrepancy between the Julian calendar (or otherwise the "old style" calendar) and the Gregorian calendar - the one that practically the whole world lives by now. The discrepancy between the calendars in the 20-21st centuries is 13.

holidays.title: World Beatles Day
holidays.description: Traditionally, on January 16th, the songs "Yesterday", "Yellow Submarine", "Let It Be" and other creations of one of the most popular music groups of all times and peoples - the legendary foursome from Liverpool, echo from the speakers and headphones of true music lovers. Since 2001.

holidays.title: Icebreaker's Day
holidays.description: On January 16, all ice makers - both professionals working on large ice arenas, and amateurs, who flood rinks in yards for children, - celebrate their professional holiday. The date was chosen in connection with the fact that it is on January 16

holidays.title: Day of Children's Inventions
holidays.description: First, a question: Do you know what unites water skis, fur earmuffs, fruit popsicles, and Braille? Yes, all these obvious items today were invented by children. Each year, more than 500,000 children and teenagers invent.

holidays.title: World Cheese Lovers Day
holidays.description: The holiday of fans of an incredibly popular dairy product is celebrated around the world on January 20 - this is World Cheese Lovers Day. Cheese is a very beneficial product. The variety of its types has allowed it to gain popularity among ordinary consumers.

holidays.title: Penguin Awareness Day
holidays.description: On January 20, the global community celebrates an environmental holiday in honor of one of the most unusual birds in the world - Penguin Awareness Day. Its goal is to increase people's knowledge about penguins and to draw attention to their preservation.

holidays.title: International Hug Day
holidays.description: January 21 is celebrated worldwide as one of the most unusual holidays - International Hug Day. It was founded in the USA in 1986 under the name National Hugging Day, and then rapidly spread

holidays.title: World Snow Day
holidays.description: In 2012, another good tradition appeared in the world - on one of the Sundays in January, at the initiative of the International Ski Federation (French: Fédération Internationale de Ski, FIS), World Snow Day (World Snow Day) is celebrated. Another one of its

holidays.title: World Religion Day
holidays.description: Annually on the third Sunday of January, the World Religion Day (World Religion Day) is celebrated worldwide, initiated by the UN. This holiday dates back to 1950 when the national governing body of the Baha'i Faith in the USA established it with the goal of promoting

holidays.title: International Ph.D. Student Day
holidays.description: January 21st is celebrated as Postgraduate Student Day in Russia. As it is also celebrated in a number of foreign countries, where the higher education system was built on the principles laid down in the USSR, this holiday has gained international status. The date of celebration is

holidays.title: Handwriting Day
holidays.description: Every year on January 23, the world celebrates Handwriting Day, a day established to remind us all about the uniqueness of handwriting, the need to practice it, and its irreplaceability.

holidays.title: World Pie Day
holidays.description: World Nutella Day, Sugar Cookie Day, World Candy and Ice Cream Days, International Pizza and Dessert Days... Holidays for every gastronomic taste and preference. January 23rd falls into the same category. On this day, World Pie Day is celebrated.

holidays.title: International Eskimo Day
holidays.description: January 24 is celebrated as a "sweet" holiday - International Eskimo Pie Day. The date for its establishment was chosen because it was on this day in 1922 that the owner of a candy store in Onawa (Iowa, USA), Christian

holidays.title: International Customs Officer's Day
holidays.description: Every year on January 26, the International Customs Day is celebrated around the world - a professional holiday for all customs service workers on the planet. The convention on the formation of the Council of Customs Cooperation came into effect in November 1952.

holidays.title: International Day WITHOUT Internet
holidays.description: As is known, in the series of holidays, there is such a holiday as Internet Day, but one should not ignore another, albeit very unusual holiday - International Internet-Free Day. It is celebrated worldwide.

holidays.title: International Data Protection Day
holidays.description: Annually on January 28, starting from 2007, International Data Protection Day (Data Protection Day) is celebrated. This holiday was established so that network users do not forget to comply with the rules of conduct on the Internet, which help

holidays.title: International LEGO Day
holidays.description: January 28th is a holiday that unites many generations of children and adults who are passionate about assembling building blocks. Perhaps, for most of them, the first association with the word "constructor" is the name "Lego". And this holiday is named

holidays.title: World Leprosy Aid Day
holidays.description: Every year, on the last Sunday of January, World Leprosy Aid Day is celebrated. This date was established in 1954 by the World Health Organization (WHO) at the initiative of French writer and philanthropist Raoul Follereau.

holidays.title: Day of Mobilization Against the Threat of Nuclear War
holidays.description: The International Mobilization Day against Nuclear War is observed worldwide on the anniversary of the adoption of the Delhi Declaration, the main goal of which is to call for an end to the nuclear arms race, reduction of

holidays.title: International Dessert Day
holidays.description: What unites such concepts as tiramisu, nougat, pudding, chak-chak, cheesecake, eclair, marzipan, apple pie, strudel, ice cream, as well as the dates 12 November and 1 February? It immediately becomes obvious to most people that this list can be continued for a very long time.

holidays.title: World Hijab Day
holidays.description: February 1st is celebrated as World Hijab Day - a holiday that is gaining popularity in many countries around the world. The main group of people who celebrate it are representatives of Islam, although there are many who are interested in this, unusual at first.

holidays.title: International Day of Transformational Games
holidays.description: The game is the best way to try to do something you've never done before. Children play from birth, for them it is a way of exploring the world, gaining new experiences, developing spiritual and physical strength. Adults, deep down, are still children. Despite the age.

holidays.title: Sled Dog Day
holidays.description: February 2 is a holiday dedicated to an animal, whose loyalty and service to humans continue to amaze us even now. It's Sled Dog Day. For most people, sled dogs are unequivocally associated with the t...

holidays.title: World Day Against Profanity

holidays.title: Birthday of rubber galoshes
holidays.description: Obviously, it will be interesting for everyone who lives by the principle of "not a day without a holiday!", wandering through the expanses of the internet, a date without any confirmed statuses, celebrated on February 4 - Rubber Galoshes Birthday. Although the date is controversial,

holidays.title: World Nutella Day
holidays.description: Annually, since 2007, February 5 is celebrated as World Nutella Day, and today this holiday received international recognition. The Nutella brand, known worldwide and extremely popular primarily among children, has ensured.

holidays.title: International Bartender's Day
holidays.description: International Bartender's Day is a professional holiday celebrated in many countries on February 6th. The date for the holiday was not chosen at random - February 6th is also the day of St. Amand (St. Amand or Amandus).

holidays.title: Mobile Phone Rejection Day
holidays.description: How many copies have been broken in the last decades discussing the issue of what mobile phones have brought more into our lives: benefits or harm? It's hard to answer. Moreover, the number of clear supporters and opponents of mass adoption of

holidays.title: International Dentist's Day
holidays.description: The tradition of celebrating International Dentist Day on February 9th is gradually becoming popular in many countries. Somewhere it is also known as Toothache Day. The date of the holiday is timed.

holidays.title: International Pizza Day
holidays.description: International Pizza Day is celebrated annually on February 9th. Few products have achieved such popularity as pizza. This simple, at first glance, Italian national dish, consisting of a thin flatbread with a filling made from tomato paste.

holidays.title: New Year according to the lunar calendar
holidays.description: New Year is the longest and most important holiday in the Chinese (lunar) calendar. Festivals and celebrations related to this holiday last for 15 days. It falls on the second new moon after the winter solstice, between January 12 and February 19.

holidays.title: World Sick Day
holidays.description: February 11th in the international calendar is designated as World Day of the Sick. This event is conceived more as a social step, aimed at supporting people who have fallen into the sad category of the sick.

holidays.title: Darwin Day
holidays.description: Darwin Day or International Day of Science and Humanism, timed to coincide with the birthday of the famous English naturalist, is celebrated annually on February 12th. Charles Darwin (Charles Darwin, 1809-1882) is the founder of the theory of evolution.

holidays.title: International Day of Marriage Agencies
holidays.description: It is noteworthy that almost on the eve of Valentine's Day - February 12 - International Day of Marriage Agencies is celebrated. This professional holiday originated in Ukraine - it was registered.

holidays.title: Mardi Gras
holidays.description: Mardi Gras (Fr. Mardi Gras) - in a literal translation from French, this sonorous phrase means "Fat Tuesday" or even "Shrove Tuesday". The holiday is celebrated in many countries around the world on Tuesday, before Ash Wednesday.

holidays.title: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: On February 14, many countries around the world celebrate Valentine's Day or the Day of all Lovers. It is believed that Valentine's Day has existed for over 16 centuries, but Love celebrations are known from even earlier times.

holidays.title: International Book Giving Day
holidays.description: February 14th is undoubtedly known, first and foremost, as Valentine's Day or the Day of all Lovers. However, the number of people who know about another holiday celebrated on this day is growing. Annually, starting from 2012, February 14th is celebrated

holidays.title: Computer Programmer's Day
holidays.description: February 14th is an unofficial but widely celebrated Computer Day in the professional world. On February 14, 1946, the first genuinely functioning electronic computer ENIAC I (Electrical Numerical Integrator and Computer) was demonstrated to the scientific world and all interested parties.

holidays.title: World Information Management Day
holidays.description: Celebrated every third Thursday of February, Global Information Governance Day is closely related to another holiday established by the decision of the International Informatics Forum in 1992 - World Information Day.

holidays.title: International Day of Children with Cancer
holidays.description: International Childhood Cancer Day, or the International Day for the Fight Against Cancer in Children, is celebrated annually on February 15th by many countries around the world. This date first appeared on the calendar in 2001 at the initiative of the international organization.

holidays.title: International Operating Room Nurse Day
holidays.description: In 2009, the International Association of Operating Room Nurses established a professional holiday in recognition of the work of operating room nurses. It was named International Operating Room Nurse Day and is celebrated annually on February 15.

holidays.title: Day of Spontaneous Kindness
holidays.description: Random Acts of Kindness Day, celebrated worldwide annually on February 17, is one of the recent initiatives of international charitable organizations. This holiday has its origins in the USA, but today it is already...

holidays.title: Battery Day
holidays.description: In mid-February, a holiday is celebrated dedicated to one of the discoveries made in the field of physics and chemistry over 200 years ago, but the fruits of which are used by every person today. This is Battery Day. February 18, 1745 was the birth

holidays.title: World Day for the Protection of Marine Mammals
holidays.description: International Marine Mammal Protection Day or World Whale Day is celebrated in many countries on February 19th. This environmental date is considered a day of protection not only for whales, but for all marine mammals.

holidays.title: World Tour Guide Day
holidays.description: Annually on February 21, many cities around the world - especially those that are tourism centers - celebrate International Tourist Guide Day. It was established by the World Federation of Tourist Guide Associations.

holidays.title: International Day of Support for Victims of Crime
holidays.description: Annually on February 22, a commemorative date is celebrated in a number of countries - the Day of Support for Victims of Crime, designed to draw attention to the problems of those who have suffered from criminal acts. The date was chosen in connection with the fact that on February 22, 1990, the ruler...

holidays.title: World Day of Slowness
holidays.description: February 26 marks an original holiday - the Day of Slowness (or Day of Deliberation), which has already acquired the "status" of an international day by now. The idea of establishing such a holiday belongs to the Italians. They are - quite

holidays.title: International Polar Bear Day
holidays.description: Annually on February 27, the world celebrates International Polar Bear Day or, in a more familiar Russian variant, White Bear Day. Its observance was initiated by a public organization dedicated to the conservation of white bears.

holidays.title: World Day of Non-Governmental Organizations
holidays.description: February 27 is celebrated as World Non-Governmental Organizations Day or World NGO Day. Sometimes the holiday is also referred to as World NPO (Non-Profit Organizations) Day. The history of the holiday's origin is associated with the actions...

holidays.title: Public Sleep Day
holidays.description: It's no secret how important sleep plays in a person's life. And, perhaps, only a human is capable of consciously ignoring (although, only for a certain time) the body's natural need for rest, where sleep plays the most important role.

holidays.title: International Day of Rare Diseases
holidays.description: On the initiative of the European Organization for Rare Diseases EURORDIS, the rarest day of the year - February 29 - officially received the status of International Rare Disease Day. In non-leap years, the holiday is celebrated on February 28.

holidays.title: World Compliment Day
holidays.description: There is no exact information about who and when such an interesting holiday as World Compliment Day was established. According to one version, it began to be celebrated in 2001 in the Netherlands. There is also no single opinion on the exact date.

holidays.title: World Civil Defense Day
holidays.description: Annually, March 1 is marked as World Civil Defence Day. In 1931, at the initiative of several states, the "Association of Geneva Zones" was founded in Paris - "safety zones", for the creation through bilateral

holidays.title: Celebration of the arrival of spring
holidays.description: On March 1, a number of countries celebrate the Festival of Spring, which has defeated winter. It is not related to Christian holidays associated with the date of Great Lent, but originates from an ancient legend about Spring. Once, the Sun descended to the earth in the image of a beautiful

holidays.title: International Matchstick Day
holidays.description: Every year on March 2nd, one of the unusual holidays is celebrated worldwide - International Matchstick Day. The reasons why this date was chosen for its establishment vary. However, the opinions agree on one thing - that matchsticks have been one of the essential tools for many decades.

holidays.title: World Writer's Day
holidays.description: The World Day of the Writer (World Day of the writer) is celebrated almost in all countries annually on March 3. The full name of this holiday is the World Peace Day for the Writer, it was established by the decision of the 48th congress of the International PEN club (Inter

holidays.title: International Children's Television and Broadcasting Day
holidays.description: International Children's Day of Broadcasting is one of the brightest and kindest holidays, celebrated on the first Sunday of March. It was established by UNICEF in 1991 and calls not to forget about the children.

holidays.title: World Hearing Day
holidays.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has established a special day dedicated to the protection of ear and hearing health. The International Day for Ear and Hearing, known to all, is celebrated annually on March 3rd.

holidays.title: World Engineering Day
holidays.description: World Engineering Day (World Engineering Day) is celebrated annually on March 4, starting from 2020. This professional holiday for engineers, scientists, and inventors was established at the initiative of the World Federation of Engineering Organizations (World Federation).

holidays.title: World Obesity Awareness Day
holidays.description: March 4 is World Obesity Day. Originally, it was observed on October 11, but the date was changed from 2020. If 20-30 years ago the problem of obesity was a topic of discussion among individual people,

holidays.title: Day of turned off gadgets
holidays.description: A huge number of advocates for the introduction of modern technologies and gadgets into our daily life are increasingly encountering counter-arguments from those who see more negative consequences in this process than positives. Even among the first group, an increasing number

holidays.title: International Dentist's Day
holidays.description: Annually on March 6th in many countries, a professional holiday for dentists is celebrated - International Dentist Day or Dentist's Day. Dentistry is one of the oldest branches of medicine. And

holidays.title: International Women's Day
holidays.description:
Beloved women come to us in springs,
They are as unexpected as rain or snow.
Beloved women come to us like stars,
When we open one among all.
"Beloved Women" music by S. Tulikov, words by M. Plyatskovsky.

holidays.title: Day of non-standard thinking people
holidays.description: March 9 is observed as the Day of Non-Standard Thinking People. Those who go beyond standard or template thinking have often been perceived, to put it mildly, ambiguously in history. Often they were not taken seriously, subjected to criticism, on

holidays.title: Day of Domestic Insects
holidays.description: Among other pets that brighten a person's loneliness, expand his world, and delight the eye, domestic insects are becoming increasingly popular. It is to them that the Day of Domestic Insects is dedicated, celebrated annually on March 9th.

holidays.title: World DJ Day
holidays.description: World DJ Day is not so much an official holiday, but an important charity campaign that has been held since 2002 on behalf of the International Club Industry. Every year, a charity week takes place worldwide.

holidays.title: Maslenitsa
holidays.description: Maslenitsa is an ancient Slavic holiday with numerous traditions, which has survived through the centuries to the present day. It is celebrated for a week before Lent. Maslenitsa in 2024 will be celebrated from March 11 to March 17. Maslenitsa is a cheerful farewell to winter.

holidays.title: Commonwealth Day
holidays.description: Commonwealth Day is an annual holiday of 56 participating countries of the international community of the Commonwealth of Nations (until 1947 - the British Commonwealth of Nations), an association of independent states that were previously part of the British Empire.

holidays.title: World Day Against Cyber Censorship
holidays.description: March 12 is a memorable date - World Day Against Cyber Censorship, established by the efforts of a number of international public organizations. The eternal problem, associated with the concepts of freedom of dissemination.

holidays.title: World Kidney Day
holidays.description: World Kidney Day is celebrated annually on the second Thursday of March, starting from 2006. Essentially, it is a global awareness and educational campaign aimed at increasing awareness about the importance of our kidneys.

holidays.title: International River Day
holidays.description: On March 14, many countries observe International Day for Rivers, previously known as International Day of Action Against Dams and for Rivers, Water and Life.

holidays.title: International Pi Day
holidays.description: March 14 is celebrated worldwide as one of the most unusual holidays - International Pi Day. The day was first celebrated in 1988 at the Exploratorium science museum in San Francisco.

holidays.title: World Consumer Rights Day
holidays.description: The customer (consumer) is always right! A popular saying. Every year on March 15, the international community celebrates World Consumer Rights Day, or World Day for Consumer Rights Protection.

holidays.title: World Sleep Day
holidays.description: The first World Sleep Day took place on March 14, 2008, at the initiative of the World Sleep Day Committee of the World Association of Sleep Medicine (WASM), and has been held every year since then.

holidays.title: International Protein Protection Day
holidays.description: The International Day of Action for the Seals, or Seal Day, is celebrated annually on March 15 in many countries around the world, it was established on the initiative of the International Fund for Animal Welfare (International Fund for Animal Welfare).

holidays.title: Day of colored pencils
holidays.description: March 16 is celebrated as Colored Pencil Day. Literally translated from Turkic as "black stone", the word and the writing instrument called "pencil" firmly entered usage in the 20th century, although the history of the pencil dates back to the era of the Ancient World.

holidays.title: Saint Patrick's Day
holidays.description: March 17 is the memorial day of the patron saint of Ireland, Saint Patrick (Eng. St. Patrick's Day, Ir. Lá ’le Pádraig). According to legend, Saint Patrick brought Christianity to the pagan island and drove out all the snakes. According to one version, he presumably died.

holidays.title: Day of the Paris Commune
holidays.description: The Day of the Paris Commune is celebrated by the world's workers to commemorate the victory of the first proletarian revolution on March 18, 1871. The decision to mark March 18 as the first successful attempt by workers to seize political power was made on February 20.

holidays.title: International Customer Day
holidays.description: There are many holidays in the world that people celebrate based on their affiliation to a certain social or professional group - Pensioner's Day, Boss's Day, Valentine's Day, Entrepreneur's Day... Recently, this list has been expanded even further.

holidays.title: World Social Work Day
holidays.description: Every year, the World Day of Social Work is celebrated on the third Tuesday of March. The initiators and organizers of this professional holiday, which unites representatives of socially-oriented work, were in 1983.

holidays.title: Earth Day
holidays.description: Worldwide, March 20, by the initiative of the UN, Earth Day is celebrated. Moreover, in the calendar of international holidays, there are two Earth Days - today's is timed to the Day of the Spring Equinox, and the second one is on April 22. The first one has a global

holidays.title: Spring equinox day
holidays.description: The Vernal Equinox is one of the most unique natural phenomena, the essence of which, in scientific terms, is that "at the moment of the equinox, the center of the Sun in its visible motion along the ecliptic crosses the celestial equator".

holidays.title: International Day of Astrology
holidays.description: International Astrology Day, annually celebrated by astrologers and enthusiasts on March 20, is timed to coincide with the day of the spring equinox. This day of a unique natural phenomenon marks the beginning of the new astrological year.

holidays.title: Navruz
holidays.description: The spring equinox holiday Navruz, originated in Khorasan (a historical region in northeastern Iran) more than 3,000 years ago, almost simultaneously with the emergence of agriculture, spread to all neighboring countries. Currently,

holidays.title: International No Meat Day
holidays.description: Many countries have been observing the International Day Without Meat since 1985. On this day, March 20th, stores and restaurants refrain from selling meat, and activists promote vegetarianism, as well as the idea of compassion towards animals.

holidays.title: International Puppeteer's Day
holidays.description: The idea to celebrate International Puppetry Day, or World Puppetry Day, all over the world came from Javad Zolfaghari, a well-known figure in puppet theater from Iran. In 2000 at the XVIII Congress...

holidays.title: Baltic Sea Day
holidays.description: The decision to annually celebrate the Baltic Sea Day was made in 1986 at the 17th meeting of the Helsinki Convention. The date of March 22 was chosen because it was on this day in 1974 that the convention itself was signed.

holidays.title: International Taxi Driver's Day
holidays.description: On March 22nd, taxi drivers around the world celebrate their professional holiday — International Taxi Driver's Day. Specifically, on this day in 1907, the first cars equipped with special meters appeared on the streets of London. The London cab drivers were called.

holidays.title: International Day of Fight Against Depression
holidays.description: Annually, on March 24th, International Day for the Fight Against Depression is observed, with the aim of drawing people's attention to mental health issues. Depression (from the Latin "deprimo" - "to suppress", "to press") is the most common mental disorder.

holidays.title: Purple Day (Epilepsy Awareness Day)

holidays.title: World Theatre Day
holidays.description: World Theatre Day (World Theatre Day) was established in 1961 by the IX Congress of the International Theatre Institute (International Theatre Institute, ITI) and is annually celebrated on March 27 by the ITI Centers and international theatre societies. Traditionally

holidays.title: International Nutritionist Day
holidays.description: Nutritionist Day is a new holiday, celebrated on March 28, the day of the launch to a broad audience of the IT platform for nutritionists Nutrify - the Israeli representation of Nutrient Planner. The initiator of the holiday was Yulia Khodos, the founder.

holidays.title: A day of walking in the park
holidays.description: An unusual and unofficial holiday, but very relevant for people living in the frantic pace of the modern world, - Take a Walk in the Park Day - is celebrated annually on March 30th. The main goal of this Day, of course, is to attract

holidays.title: International Backup Day (Backup Day)
holidays.description: International Backup Day (English: World Backup Day) or Backup Day (from English: backup) is held annually on March 31. Backup (backup) is the creation of a copy of important data (for example, family photos, videos, documents).

holidays.title: April Fool's Day
holidays.description: April Fool's Day (April Fools' Day or All Fool's Day) or Laughter Day is an international holiday celebrated worldwide on April 1. On this day, it is customary to play pranks on relatives, friends, and just acquaintances, or joke about them. Where exactly it originated from.

holidays.title: International Bird Day
holidays.description: Every year on April 1, International Bird Day is celebrated - an international environmental holiday. Its purpose is to preserve the species diversity and number of birds. It originated in the American state of Pennsylvania, as a children's

holidays.title: The birthday of cognac
holidays.description: April 1st is an unofficial holiday, known primarily among cognac producers and fans of strong alcoholic beverages – the Birthday of Cognac. Cognac is a strong alcoholic drink.

holidays.title: International Children's Book Day
holidays.description: Blooming pink bushes peered from the roof into the open window; their children's chairs were right there. Kai and Gerda each sat on their own and took each other's hands. The cold, desolate grandeur of the Snow Queen's halls was forgotten by them, like a heavy

holidays.title: World Party Day
holidays.description: April 3rd is a fun unofficial holiday - World Party Day or World Party Day (World Party Day). Also known as P-Day. The word "party", which is often used in the lexicon of young people today, is borrowed from English.

holidays.title: Internet Day
holidays.description: In many countries around the world, April 4th is annually celebrated as Internet Day, which was sanctioned by Pope John Paul II in 1998 and timed to the day of the passing of Saint Isidore of Seville. However, the official patron saint of the Internet has not yet been appointed.

holidays.title: Webmaster's Day
holidays.description: April 4th is marked as the unofficial professional holiday - Webmaster's Day (or Webmaster). The date of this holiday is not chosen by chance: if you look closely, you can notice that the numbers 4.04 strongly resemble the 404 error ("Not found") in their writing.

holidays.title: World Rat Day
holidays.description: Every year on April 4th, starting from 2003, an unusual holiday is celebrated - World Rat Day (World Rat Day), created to draw attention to this extraordinary animal and aimed at uniting decorative rat enthusiasts all over the world.

holidays.title: International Soup Day
holidays.description: Soup is the first course and an important part of the daily diet. To emphasize once again the importance of this dish for human health, a holiday was created - International Soup Day, which is celebrated on April 5th. The history of soup is as old as...

holidays.title: Geologist's Day
holidays.description: Traditionally, Geologist's Day is celebrated annually on the first Sunday of April in a number of post-Soviet countries. This professional holiday was established by the Decree of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR on March 31, 1966, to commemorate the merits of.

holidays.title: International Roma Day
holidays.description: International Roma (Gypsy) Day, which is celebrated annually on April 8 by representatives of this nation around the world, was established at the first World Gypsy Congress, held in London on April 8, 1971.

holidays.title: Brothers and Sisters Day

holidays.description: Annually on October 22, starting from 1998, the International Stuttering Awareness Day (ISAD) is celebrated worldwide, also known as the International Day for the Dissemination of Information about Stuttering. The idea for the establishment of this date was born.
